result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell P Szepi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 46 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to any other county.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AMENDED 02-10-2016:  Extradition Costs are set at $400.  Cash bail applied.  All costs are PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victim or their residence or co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Restitution is to be determined.
Amended 02-10-2016:  Restitution is set as Extradition Costs.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Defendant Mitchell P Szepi in court, in custody, with attorney John Scott Schiro.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective David Voigt from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects to the bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Schiro makes a Motion to Modify bail. State has no objection to lowering of the bail.
